study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the acute effects of unilateral hamstring foam rolling on contralateral limb flexibility, isometric strength, and rate of force development (RFD).
results_summary: Unilateral hamstring foam rolling improved contralateral limb range of motion but decreased early-phase rate of force development (RFD) during maximal explosive contractions. No changes were observed in contralateral isometric strength or maximal EMG amplitude.
population_specificity: 34 subjects (21 women) with no further demographic details provided.
effective_dosage: Ten sets of 30-second foam rolling sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the acute effect of hamstring foam rolling on proprioception at the knee and hip joints.
results_summary: Foam rolling improved knee joint position sense for at least 20 minutes post-intervention without negatively affecting hip joint position sense or knee joint force sense, suggesting it can be used prior to exercise without causing proprioceptive deficits. No significant differences were found in hip position matching error or knee force matching error at any post-intervention time point.
population_specificity: 25 participants (specific demographics not provided).
study_duration: Acute (effects measured at zero, 10, and 20 minutes post-intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of foam rolling before and after exercise on performance (sprint, jump, strength), flexibility, and muscle pain, and to determine whether foam rollers or roller massagers were more effective.
results_summary: Pre-rolling slightly improved sprint performance and flexibility but had negligible effects on jump and strength. Post-rolling modestly mitigated exercise-induced declines in sprint and strength performance and reduced muscle pain, with trivial effects on jump performance. Foam rollers showed a tendency for better strength recovery than roller massagers, but overall effects were minor.
population_specificity: Athletes or individuals in sport settings (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of vibration foam rolling (VFR) and non-vibration foam rolling (NVFR) on pain perception, pressure pain threshold, oxygen saturation, jump performance, and range of movement after inducing muscle damage.
results_summary: VFR showed greater short-term improvements in pain perception and hip joint range of movement compared to NVFR. Both protocols improved pressure pain threshold, oxygen saturation, jump performance, and knee joint range of movement.
population_specificity: 38 healthy volunteers (32 men, 6 women; aged 22.2±3.2 years).
effective_dosage: 1 minute per leg for five sets, with 30-second rests between sets.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationship between different forms of folic acid and lung cancer risk using a national population-based survey.
results_summary: The study found significant associations between various forms of folic acid (total folate, dietary folate, 5-formylTHF, and 5,10-methenylTHF) and lung cancer risk, with non-linear relationships observed for some forms. Folic acid and related compounds were positively correlated with lung cancer within certain dose ranges.
population_specificity: 27,631 participants from the 2007-2018 National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES), with 201 included after propensity score matching.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of different self-massage volumes (60 vs. 120 seconds) and modalities (foam rolling vs. roller massage) on passive hip range-of-motion.
results_summary: Both foam rolling and roller massage increased hip range-of-motion, with larger volumes (120 seconds) and foam rolling producing the greatest improvements, though some changes did not exceed the minimum detectable change at certain time points.
population_specificity: Twenty-five recreationally resistance-trained men.
study_duration: Immediate effects measured up to 30 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a folate receptor-targeted drug delivery system (AgNNPs-FA) using folic acid as a targeting agent for ovarian cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that AgNNPs-FA demonstrated superior targeted anticancer activity compared to non-targeted AgNNPs in human ovarian adenocarcinoma (SK-OV-3) through various in vitro and in vivo assays, suggesting its potential as an alternative treatment for ovarian cancer.
population_specificity: Human ovarian adenocarcinoma (SK-OV-3) cell line and fertilized eggs (CAM assay).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a case of severe bilateral optic neuropathy associated with FOLFOX plus nivolumab treatment in a patient with advanced gastric cancer.
results_summary: The study found that FOLFOX plus nivolumab treatment led to irreversible bilateral optic neuropathy and vision loss in a patient, despite discontinuation of chemotherapy and high-dose corticosteroid therapy. The findings suggest the need for close ophthalmologic monitoring in patients receiving this treatment regimen.
population_specificity: A 48-year-old woman with a Krukenberg tumor (HER2-negative advanced gastric cancer).
effective_dosage: Not specified for Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).
study_duration: Not specified for Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).
interactions: None mentioned for Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-cancer potential of folate-targeted liposomal Bleomycin (FL-Bleomycin) compared to non-targeted formulations, focusing on cytotoxicity, cell cycle arrest, and internalization in oral cavity cancer cells.
results_summary: FL-Bleomycin demonstrated significantly higher cytotoxicity and improved internalization in CAL27 cells compared to non-targeted formulations, effectively arresting the cell cycle in the G2/M phase and showing a consistent drug release profile.
population_specificity: Oral cavity cancer cells (CAL27)

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate survival, treatment patterns, and chemotherapy use in pancreatic cancer patients, not Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).
results_summary: The study did not investigate Folic Acid (Vitamin B9); it focused on chemotherapy regimens and survival outcomes in pancreatic cancer patients.
population_specificity: Patients with pancreatic cancer (n=113), including those with histologically/cytologically confirmed pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (n=86) and radiologically diagnosed cases (n=27).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a nutrition intervention (including iron-folic acid) on micronutrient status, inflammation biomarkers, and associations with birth outcomes and infant neurodevelopment.
results_summary: The study evaluated the effects of iron-folic acid (IFA) as part of a broader nutrition intervention but did not isolate folic acid's specific outcomes. Results on micronutrient status and birth outcomes are pending further analysis.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in Amhara, Ethiopia (n=2399, with a subset of 532 for biospecimen analysis).
effective_dosage: Not specified (IFA dosage not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: From enrollment (<24 weeks gestation) until 1 month postpartum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid (FA) could mitigate methotrexate (MTX)-induced exacerbation of atherosclerosis in microminipigs fed a high-fat and high-cholesterol diet.
results_summary: Folic acid attenuated MTX-induced increases in homocysteine levels and atherosclerosis lesion thickness, suggesting a protective effect against MTX-related vascular damage. The study linked reduced blood FA levels to worsened atherosclerosis, highlighting FA's potential role in mitigating MTX's adverse effects.
population_specificity: Microminipigs (μMPs) fed a high-fat and high-cholesterol diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of folic acid on DNA methylation and gene expression in adipocytes from SLE patients, focusing on obesity's influence on these epigenetic changes.
results_summary: Folic acid induced differential methylation at 755 CpG sites in normal-weight adipocytes (linked to immune regulation) and 92 CpG sites in obese adipocytes (linked to metabolic regulation). LEP gene expression increased in obese adipocytes, while CREM2 expression rose in normal-weight adipocytes, highlighting weight-dependent responses.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), subdivided into normal-weight and obese groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of folic acid in treating methanol poisoning and its potential protective effects against optic neuropathy.
results_summary: Folic acid, as part of a combined treatment, contributed to the patient's rapid recovery of consciousness and metabolic normalization, with preserved visual function despite severe methanol toxicity. The case suggests folic acid may help mitigate neurological damage in methanol poisoning.
population_specificity: 15-year-old male with severe methanol poisoning.
study_duration: Administered during acute treatment phase (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the credibility and certainty of evidence regarding the associations of homocysteine (Hcy) and Hcy-lowering therapies, specifically folic acid, with various health outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid significantly reduced the risk of stroke, supported by observational, Mendelian randomization, and interventional meta-analyses. It also suggested potential benefits for dementia and colorectal cancer, though convincing evidence was limited to digestive tract cancer.
population_specificity: Not specified (umbrella review of multiple studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify predictive variables, including folic acid levels, for successful weight loss one year after Sleeve bariatric surgery.
results_summary: Folic acid was identified as one of the key predictive variables for successful weight loss (exceeding 30%) post-surgery, alongside other biochemical and anthropometric factors. The SVM model, which included folic acid, achieved 88% accuracy in predicting outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent Sleeve bariatric surgery (n=94) from the Nutrition Section of the Endocrinology and Nutrition Department in Valladolid, Spain (2013-2018).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of folic acid (FA) as a targeting agent in a multifunctional nanoplatform to enhance methotrexate delivery and therapeutic efficacy in rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
results_summary: The study found that folic acid, as part of the nanoplatform, significantly improved the accumulation of methotrexate at RA lesion sites (~3.5-fold) and contributed to macrophage polarization from pro-inflammatory M1 to anti-inflammatory M2, improving the inflammatory microenvironment.
population_specificity: Collagen-induced arthritis (CIA) model (animal study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid could effectively target hepatocellular carcinoma tumor cells as part of a nanoparticle system designed to induce cuproptosis and pyroptosis for antitumor immunotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid facilitated targeted delivery of nanoparticles to hepatocellular carcinoma cells, contributing to copper ion overload, ROS storms, and mitochondrial damage, ultimately inducing immunogenic cell death and inhibiting tumor growth and metastasis.
population_specificity: Hepatocellular carcinoma tumor cells (in vitro or animal model, not specified for human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how Nephrology II Decoction (NED) alleviates chronic kidney disease (CKD), particularly its impact on STING-mediated mitochondrial balance in kidney cells, using folic acid nephropathy (FAN) as one of the models.
results_summary: NED improved renal function, reduced fibrosis, and corrected mitochondrial dysfunction in CKD mice, including those with folic acid-induced nephropathy. It inhibited the cGAS/STING pathway, reducing inflammation and apoptosis.
population_specificity: CKD mouse models (FAN, UUO, bIRI) and HK2 renal tubular cells.
effective_dosage: Not specified for folic acid; NED administered via oral gavage for three weeks.
interactions: Potential interaction observed with STING agonist DMXAA.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of folate-adorned nanocarriers (FNCs) for targeted delivery in melanoma therapy, focusing on folate receptor (FR) targeting mechanisms and applications.
results_summary: The study highlights that FNCs offer benefits such as site-specific targeting, cargo protection, and reduced toxicity, with potential applications in immunotherapy, photodynamic therapy, chemotherapy, gene therapy, photothermal therapy, and tumor imaging for melanoma.
population_specificity: Melanoma (tumor-specific, not human subjects directly studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of folic acid in preventing neural tube defects (NTDs) and its interaction with other etiological factors.
results_summary: The study highlights folic acid supplementation as a preventive measure for NTDs, suggesting its effectiveness when combined with other interventions like inositol supplementation. It emphasizes the importance of addressing pre-pregnancy nutritional deficiencies to reduce NTD risk.
population_specificity: Pregnant women or those planning pregnancy, particularly focusing on early pregnancy stages (first month).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of interventions, including folic acid supplements, for managing anemia in pregnancy.
results_summary: The study found that multiple micronutrient supplements were more cost-effective than iron and folic acid supplements alone for managing anemia in pregnancy.
population_specificity: Pregnant women, particularly in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic potential of folic acid (FA) and ferrous sulfate (FS) in mitigating renal dysfunction caused by alcohol-acetaminophen-induced liver cirrhosis.
results_summary: Folic acid, both individually and in combination with ferrous sulfate, restored antioxidant enzyme activity and glycolytic pathway levels affected by liver cirrhosis, demonstrating efficacy in reducing oxidative damage.
population_specificity: Rats with alcohol-acetaminophen-induced liver cirrhosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore strategies to mitigate methotrexate (MTX) resistance in cancer therapy, including potential benefits of coadministering fat-soluble vitamins (A, D, E, K) with MTX, but did not specifically focus on folic acid (Vitamin B9).
results_summary: The study reviewed mechanisms of MTX resistance and suggested that fat-soluble vitamins (A, D, E, K) could enhance chemotherapy efficacy by inhibiting drug transporters like P-glycoprotein, but did not directly assess folic acid's effects.
population_specificity: Cancer patients (non-small cell lung cancer mentioned) and general research on MTX resistance mechanisms.

study_goal: The study aimed to investigate the predictive value of pretreatment nutritional and inflammatory markers (including serum albumin and lymphocyte counts) for treatment response in geriatric gastric cancer patients receiving neoadjuvant FLOT chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that higher serum albumin levels and lower lymphocyte counts were associated with better treatment response and extended survival in geriatric gastric cancer patients. However, the study did not assess the effects of Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).
population_specificity: Geriatric gastric cancer patients (≥65 years old) receiving neoadjuvant FLOT chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the antioxidant activity and developmental effects of folic acid (Vitamin B9) in mitigating oxidative stress during in vitro maturation of porcine oocytes.
results_summary: Treatment with 0.3 FA significantly reduced ROS activity, inhibited abnormal spindle organization and chromosomal misalignment, and improved blastocyst formation while decreasing apoptotic cells.
population_specificity: Porcine oocytes subjected to oxidative stress during in vitro maturation.
effective_dosage: 0.3 FA (specific unit not clarified in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of modified FOLFIRINOX chemotherapy followed by pancreaticoduodenectomy as a treatment for locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
results_summary: The study reported a near-complete pathological response after surgical treatment in a patient with locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma, suggesting potential curative surgical resection as a viable option for advanced cases. The patient achieved remission without adjuvant therapy.
population_specificity: A female patient in her fourth decade with locally advanced pancreatic adenocarcinoma.
effective_dosage: Not specified for Folic Acid (Vitamin B9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid-conjugated nanoparticles could enhance the targeted delivery and efficacy of letrozole in hormone receptor-positive breast cancer cells.
results_summary: Folic acid-functionalized nanoparticles showed higher drug entrapment, controlled release in acidic conditions, increased cytotoxicity, and enhanced apoptosis in MCF-7 cells compared to non-functionalized nanoparticles. The treatment also altered gene expression to promote cell death and inhibit invasion.
population_specificity: Hormone receptor-positive breast cancer cells (MCF-7).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of a multidisciplinary treatment approach, including addressing folic acid deficiency, on chronic pharyngitis patients' quality of life.
results_summary: The study found that 48.57% of patients had folic acid deficiency, but the abstract does not specify direct outcomes related to folic acid supplementation. The multidisciplinary approach, which may have included folic acid correction, significantly improved quality of life scores.
population_specificity: 140 chronic pharyngitis patients (82 male, 58 female) with a mean age of 42.2 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness of NALIRIFOX versus GemNab for treating metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (mPDAC) in treatment-naive patients.
results_summary: NALIRIFOX showed a slight clinical advantage over GemNab but was only borderline cost-effective at the highest willingness-to-pay threshold ($150,000/QALY). At lower thresholds, it did not demonstrate cost-effectiveness.
population_specificity: Treatment-naive patients with metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (mPDAC).
study_duration: Lifetime horizon (13-year analysis) with 4-week cycle lengths.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential role of folate (Vitamin B9) in improving mitochondrial homeostasis and altering epigenetic patterns in immune and inflammatory genes related to periodontal disease (PD).
results_summary: The study suggests that folate may benefit PD by supporting DNA methylation, improving mitochondrial quality control, and exerting antioxidant effects against reactive oxygen and nitrogen species. A folate-based dietary intervention is recommended for PD prevention and adjunct therapy, though further research is needed.
population_specificity: Individuals with periodontal disease (PD) and controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the tumor-targeting capabilities and therapeutic efficacy of folic acid-functionalized magnetic diatom microrobots for neuroblastoma treatment.
results_summary: Folic acid-functionalized microrobots demonstrated enhanced drug conjugation and tumor-targeting capabilities, leading to improved therapeutic efficacy and reduced off-target effects in neuroblastoma therapy.
population_specificity: Pediatric neuroblastoma (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of folic acid-functionalized liquid metal nanoparticles for targeted drug delivery in photodynamic therapy (PDT) for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid (FA) enhanced tumor-specific targeting when conjugated to gallium-indium nanoparticles, improving the delivery and efficacy of the photosensitizer (BPD) in PDT. The FA-functionalized nanoparticles demonstrated potent PDT efficacy despite reduced cellular uptake, indicating successful intracellular delivery.
population_specificity: In vitro (cell-based) study; no human or animal subjects specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a social norms-based intervention could improve iron and folic acid consumption behaviors among women of reproductive age to reduce anemia.
results_summary: The intervention significantly improved descriptive and collective social norms, which predicted increased iron and folic acid consumption. Treatment communities showed greater relative improvement in consumption over time compared to controls.
population_specificity: Women aged 15-49 in Odisha, India, who spoke Odiya and did not plan to move in the next year.
study_duration: 18 months (baseline, midline at 6 months, end-line at 18 months)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid intake during pregnancy was associated with reduced risk of adverse maternal outcomes in women giving birth in eastern Ethiopia.
results_summary: Folic acid intake during pregnancy significantly reduced the risk of adverse maternal outcomes (ARR = 0.47; 95% CI: 0.38-0.57), demonstrating a protective effect. The study did not report adverse effects or safety concerns related to folic acid.
population_specificity: Women who gave birth in six public hospitals in eastern Ethiopia (n=2,608).
study_duration: Duration of pregnancy (exact length not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze scientometric characteristics and research trends of Burning Mouth Syndrome (BMS), including the role of pharmacologic interventions like folic acid.
results_summary: Folic acid was identified as one of the more frequent pharmacologic keywords in BMS research post-2015, suggesting its emerging relevance in treatment strategies, but no specific efficacy data was provided.
population_specificity: Patients with Burning Mouth Syndrome (BMS).

study_goal: The study aimed to determine whether molecular hyperselection via next-generation sequencing could improve targeted therapy selection in RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer, comparing anti-EGFR and anti-VEGF treatments.
results_summary: The study found that hyperselected patients (no predefined genetic alterations) had improved survival with anti-EGFR therapy (38.5 months vs. 27.5 months), while patients with gene alterations showed no significant difference in survival between anti-EGFR and anti-VEGF treatments.
population_specificity: 199 patients with RAS/BRAF wild-type, MMR proficient metastatic colorectal cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate cases of folate receptor-α deficiency in Türkiye, focusing on clinical findings, genetic analysis, and treatment outcomes with folinic acid.
results_summary: The study identified a novel FOLR1 gene variant and found that folinic acid treatment, alongside vagus nerve stimulation, could be effective in managing symptoms like seizures, though delayed diagnosis reduced treatment efficacy.
population_specificity: Nine cases from six families in Türkiye, predominantly with parental consanguinity, presenting developmental delays, epilepsy, and MRI abnormalities.
effective_dosage: 5.2 mg/kg/day PO folinic acid, with varying IV folinate doses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of mandatory folic acid fortification on schizophrenia rates across 194 jurisdictions between 1990 and 2019.
results_summary: The study found that mandatory folic acid fortification was associated with lower schizophrenia prevalence and incidence, particularly in the 15-39 age group, with larger effects observed in both sexes. The highest dose tertile showed the lowest incidence and smallest increase in prevalence in this age group.
population_specificity: 194 jurisdictions globally, with specific focus on adolescents and young adults (15-39 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (highest dose tertile mentioned but exact amounts not provided).
study_duration: Data analyzed from 1990 to 2019 (duration of fortification varied by jurisdiction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate the CGMH nomogram for predicting overall survival in metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma patients treated with nanoliposomal irinotecan plus 5-fluorouracil and leucovorin.
results_summary: The CGMH nomogram effectively stratified patients into good, intermediate, and poor prognostic groups, with median overall survival times of 8.7, 5.7, and 4.0 months, respectively, and demonstrated strong predictive ability (c-indices of 0.73 and 0.70 for 6- and 12-month survival predictions).
population_specificity: Patients with metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma receiving second-line nanoliposomal irinotecan plus 5-fluorouracil and leucovorin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folate-biofortified lettuce could effectively increase folate levels and provide a significant portion of the recommended daily intake.
results_summary: Transgenic lettuce plants showed up to 3.4 times higher folate content than non-transgenic lettuce and 1.9 times more than spinach, with stable folate levels over two years of field trials. A serving of this lettuce could provide 36-64% of the recommended daily folate intake.
population_specificity: Lettuce plants (transgenic and non-transgenic) cultivated under greenhouse and field conditions.
effective_dosage: Not specified (folate content measured per serving).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of WhatsApp reminder messages in improving knowledge and adherence to the Weekly Iron-Folic Acid Supplementation (WIFAS) program among adolescent girls.
results_summary: The WhatsApp-based intervention significantly improved knowledge scores, adherence to WIFAS (measured by consumption in the preceding week and at least 75% of distributed supplements), and mean hemoglobin levels compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Adolescent girls in the Salahutu Sub-District, Maluku Province, Indonesia.
effective_dosage: Not specified (weekly supplementation as per WIFAS program).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a folate receptor-targeted liposomal delivery system using folic acid to improve the solubility and targeted delivery of TGX221 for prostate cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that the folic acid-modified liposomes effectively delivered TGX221 to prostate cancer cells, enhanced drug accumulation in tumors, and activated a signaling pathway promoting cancer cell death via endoplasmic reticulum stress.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer (PC-3 cells and in vivo models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify natural STAT5a inhibitors, including Folic Acid, through molecular docking and dynamics simulations for potential prostate cancer therapy.
results_summary: Folic Acid showed strong binding energy (-10.1 kcal/mol) to the STAT5a SH2 domain, comparable to a clinical STAT5 inhibitor, and demonstrated stable protein-ligand interactions in molecular dynamics simulations.
population_specificity: In silico (computational) study, no human or animal subjects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether quintuply-fortified salt (QFS) containing folic acid altered the gut microbiome of non-pregnant women of reproductive age after 12 months.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in gut microbiome diversity or relative abundance of specific taxa after 12 months of QFS consumption, suggesting folic acid in QFS did not alter the gut microbiome.
population_specificity: Non-pregnant women of reproductive age (18-49 years) in Punjab, India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a personalized mHealth intervention could improve folic acid supplement use compliance among pregnant women compared to conventional face-to-face counseling.
results_summary: The intervention group showed a 20% improvement in daily folic acid use, but the difference compared to the nonintervention group (22.4%) was not statistically significant (aOR 1.26, 95% CI 0.68-2.36; P=.46).
population_specificity: First-trimester pregnant women from Aga Khan University Hospital who owned smartphones with internet access.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folate (Vitamin B9) supplementation, alone or with vitamin B6, improves treatment responses in patients with bipolar I disorder experiencing acute manic episodes when used alongside sodium valproate.
results_summary: Folate supplementation significantly reduced manic symptoms (measured by YMRS scores) compared to placebo and folate plus vitamin B6, with 80% of folate-treated patients showing over 50% symptom reduction after 3 weeks. Vitamin B6 did not provide additional benefits.
population_specificity: 43 patients diagnosed with bipolar I disorder presenting with acute manic episodes.
effective_dosage: 5 mg/day folate (with or without 80 mg/day vitamin B6).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of folic acid (FA) as a targeting ligand in liposomal drug delivery systems for breast cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid receptor targeting enhances cellular uptake and cytotoxicity in breast cancer cells, improving drug delivery and efficacy. However, challenges such as tumor heterogeneity and limited penetration remain.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cells (in vitro or preclinical models, not explicitly specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a multifunctional nanoplatform (CDPNF NPs) incorporating folic acid (FA) as a targeting moiety for precision antitumor therapy.
results_summary: The CDPNF NPs demonstrated highly efficient antitumor effects, achieving a ∼97% tumor inhibition rate under NIR light irradiation, with good biocompatibility. The FA-directed nanoplatform facilitated targeted delivery and in situ activation of cytotoxic agents in the tumor microenvironment.
population_specificity: In vivo experiments (specific population not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid-conjugated micelles could enhance targeted delivery of donepezil across the blood-brain barrier for Alzheimer's disease treatment.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that folic acid-functionalized micelles improved drug delivery across an in vitro BBB model and enhanced cellular uptake by brain endothelial cells, suggesting potential for targeted Alzheimer's therapy.
population_specificity: In vitro blood-brain barrier model and brain endothelial cells (not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether there is a causal relationship between folic acid (Vitamin B9) and osteoarthritis (OA) using Mendelian randomization.
results_summary: The study found no significant causal relationship between folic acid and OA (P = 0.664), indicating that folic acid does not influence OA risk.
population_specificity: European ancestry participants from the FinnGen Biobank in Finland.

study_goal: The researchers explored the potential of folic acid-functionalized silk fibroin hydrogels/scaffolds for targeted drug delivery in breast cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study highlighted that folic acid-functionalized silk fibroin hydrogels/scaffolds could effectively target breast cancer cells overexpressing folate receptors, suggesting potential for improved drug delivery and therapeutic outcomes.
population_specificity: Breast cancer cells (in vitro or preclinical context, not specified for human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of folic acid (FA) as a targeting ligand in polymeric micelles for delivering doxorubicin (DOX) to leukemic cells.
results_summary: FA-conjugated micelles showed higher cellular uptake and cytotoxicity in folate receptor-positive K562 cells compared to free DOX and non-FA micelles, indicating FA's role in enhancing targeted drug delivery. The micelles exhibited sustained drug release and high entrapment efficiency.
population_specificity: Folate receptor-positive (K562) and negative (HepG2) cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of mFOLFIRINOX (which includes Folic Acid) in treating recurrent hepatic metastases of IPMC.
results_summary: The study found that mFOLFIRINOX achieved a complete response (CR) in hepatic metastases after 8 courses, with sustained remission over 21 courses and no recurrence for a subsequent year.
population_specificity: A 76-year-old female with recurrent hepatic metastases of IPMC.
effective_dosage: Not specified (mFOLFIRINOX regimen typically includes leucovorin, a form of Folic Acid, but exact dosage not detailed in abstract).
study_duration: 21 courses (exact duration per course not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which folic acid deficiency exacerbates ischemic stroke and the role of lncRNA H19 in mediating inflammatory responses.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid deficiency worsened neurological injury in ischemic stroke by up-regulating lncRNA H19 and inflammatory cytokines, both in peripheral blood and brain tissue. Blocking H19 mitigated inflammation and partially reversed neuronal injury exacerbated by folic acid deficiency.
population_specificity: Patients with ischemic stroke and MCAO/R rats (animal model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of folic acid-modified nanosystems for targeted imaging and therapy in advanced prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid modification enabled targeted delivery of the nanosystem to prostate cancer cells, enhancing imaging and therapeutic efficacy when combined with photothermal therapy and chemotherapy. The approach overcame limitations of single-modality treatments by downregulating HSP70 and inducing apoptosis.
population_specificity: Advanced prostate cancer patients (preclinical study, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the synergistic effects of folic acid-functionalized iron single-atom catalysts (FeNC-FA) in enhancing catalytic and mild photothermal therapy for targeted tumor treatment.
results_summary: The study found that FeNC-FA induced reactive oxygen species (ROS) storm and depleted glutathione (GSH) in the tumor microenvironment, initiating ferroptosis and enhancing mild photothermal therapy (mPTT). The increased temperature further facilitated H2O2 conversion to O2, alleviating hypoxia and boosting catalytic therapy, while photoacoustic imaging enabled self-monitoring of tumor accumulation.
population_specificity: Tumor microenvironment (in vitro and in vivo models)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid (FA) could attenuate atherosclerotic lesion formation in diabetic mice by upregulating DHFR and recoupling eNOS.
results_summary: Oral administration of folic acid robustly attenuated atherosclerotic lesion formation in diabetic mice, similar to the effect of NOX1 deletion, by upregulating DHFR and recoupling eNOS.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin (STZ)-induced type 1 diabetic mice (apoE-/- background).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid-functionalized nanogels could improve targeted delivery of 5-aminolevulinic acid (5-ALA) for photodynamic therapy in skin cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid-targeted nanogels enhanced 5-ALA concentration in tumor cells, improved photodynamic therapy efficiency in vitro, and significantly inhibited skin cancer development in vivo.
population_specificity: Skin cancer cells (A2058) and in vivo models (specific organism not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid (FA) could enhance tumor-targeting and therapeutic efficacy when combined with icaritin (ICA) and low-temperature photothermal therapy (LTPTT) in a novel nanodrug delivery system for colorectal cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that folic acid (FA) facilitated active targeting of tumor tissues due to its high affinity for cancer cells, enabling controlled release of ICA under acidic intracellular conditions. The SiO2/Ica-PDA-FA nanocomposite demonstrated synergistic antitumor effects when combined with LTPTT, improving therapeutic outcomes in CRC.
population_specificity: Mouse xenograft model (preclinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the association between metformin administration and serum levels of homocysteine, vitamin B12, folic acid, and zinc in patients with type 2 diabetes, particularly focusing on kidney dysfunction.
results_summary: The study measured serum folic acid levels but did not report significant findings or associations related to folic acid in the context of metformin administration or kidney function.
population_specificity: 149 patients with type 2 diabetes (96 men, 53 women), including those with diabetic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a folic acid-targeted liposome drug delivery system (LSF) for improving liver tumor therapy with Sorafenib.
results_summary: The study found that LSF effectively inhibited liver cancer cells in vitro, induced apoptosis, and reduced tumor growth in vivo while minimizing side effects of Sorafenib. The system demonstrated stability and targeted delivery.
population_specificity: Liver cancer cells (in vitro) and liver xenograft model (in vivo).
effective_dosage: Not specified for folic acid alone; drug loading content of LSF was 3.6%.
study_duration: Stability tested over 24 hours; in vivo duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of FOLFOXIRI therapy (which includes folinic acid) as upfront treatment for marginally unresectable locally advanced rectal cancer without distant metastasis.
results_summary: The study found that FOLFOXIRI therapy was well tolerated, with an 80% R0 resection rate, but reported several grade ≥3 adverse effects, including neutropenia, anemia, and fatigue. The therapy showed comparable efficacy for achieving potential R0 resection in the studied population.
population_specificity: Patients with marginally unresectable locally advanced rectal cancer without distant metastasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining primary tumor sidedness (PTS) with liver-limited disease (LLD) status improves the prediction of treatment benefit for RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) patients receiving FOLFIRI plus cetuximab or bevacizumab.
results_summary: The study found that FOLFIRI/Cet showed significant overall survival benefit in left-sided/non-LLD patients but mitigated benefit in left-sided/LLD patients, while FOLFIRI/Bev was favored in right-sided/non-LLD patients. Right-sided/LLD patients may still benefit from anti-EGFR therapy despite right-sided primary tumors.
population_specificity: Patients with RAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) and unresectable metastasis.
effective_dosage: Not specified (folinic acid was part of the FOLFIRI regimen, but exact dosage not detailed).
study_duration: Not specified (first-line treatment duration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether folic acid-modified layered double hydroxides (FA-LDH) could target M1 macrophages and modulate macrophage repolarization to alleviate inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: FA-LDH reduced proinflammatory cytokine release, promoted M2 macrophage markers, and down-regulated the NF-κB pathway via the pSmad5/p65 axis, leading to reduced limb swelling, inflammatory cell infiltration, and joint protection in collagen-induced arthritis mice.
population_specificity: Collagen-induced arthritis mice (animal model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether severe folic acid deficiency could lead to severe haemolytic anaemia and assess the response to high-dose oral folic acid treatment.
results_summary: The study found that severe folic acid deficiency caused severe haemolytic anaemia in a patient with beta thalassaemia trait, which improved significantly after three months of high-dose oral folic acid treatment, restoring haemoglobin and folate levels.
population_specificity: A 20-year-old woman of Pakistani origin with beta thalassaemia trait.
effective_dosage: High-dose oral folic acid (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Ayurvedic intervention (including folic acid supplementation) in managing menorrhagia and its impact on quality of life.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, but folic acid was administered alongside iron and other treatments to address anemia associated with menorrhagia. Final efficacy data will be available after completion.
population_specificity: Indian women aged 20-40 years with menorrhagia.
effective_dosage: 1.5 mg of folic acid twice daily (combined with 100 mg elemental iron).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pathological response to neoadjuvant FLOT chemotherapy (which includes leucovorin, a folic acid derivative) could guide the use of adjuvant FLOT in patients with gastro-oesophageal adenocarcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that adjuvant FLOT provided significant disease-free and overall survival benefits only in partial responders, with no significant benefits observed in minimal or complete responders.
population_specificity: Patients with non-metastatic gastro-oesophageal adenocarcinoma from 43 hospitals across 12 countries.
